translation.en: [man1] It was a beautiful day.
You could feel the heat from the volcano.
You could feel that the ground was warm.
[man2] You kind of get these beautiful yellow colors.
Dark, dark oranges as well.
[man3] I mean, just colors everywhere.
Steam popping up out of the ground…
It was an absolutely breathtaking sight.
translation.ko: 정말 숨이 멎을 것 같은 광경이었어요

translation.en: [woman] It looked like Mars or something.
There was a lot more steam than I thought there would be.
[man1] You knew there was something
beautiful and terrible, and you wanted to see it…
translation.ko: 아름답고도 끔찍한 모두가 보고 싶어 하는 거죠

translation.en: but our tour guides just said, "Do not go near the edge of the crater."
translation.ko: 하지만 가이드가 분화구에 가까이 가면 안 된다고 했어요

translation.en: [woman2] I was getting really anxious.
And I talked to our tour guide,
and I asked him, "What do we do if there is an eruption,
because I'm getting a little nervous here?"
[man2] I love my wife more than anything
translation.ko: 전 제 아내를 그 무엇보다 사랑해요

translation.en: but being anxious is not an unusual situation for her
so I did just brush it off for the most part.
translation.ko: 그래서 전 그냥 별거 아니라고 여겼어요

translation.en: They even said the words, "It's not going to erupt."
[man1] As a young Kiwi,
what better place to grow up?
translation.ko: 어떤 곳이 자라기에 더 좋은 환경일까요?

translation.en: You got the hills, and the hunting and the fishing.
And the ocean to swim in.
You know, it… it… there's nothing better.
Whakatāne is a beautiful community, full of adventure.
[woman] Geographically, we are on the east coast of the North Island.
Auckland's here.
And then down the coast is Whakatāne.
People would pronounce it "Wock-a-tain" or "Feck-a-tah-nee" or
"Wock-a-tah-nee" or whatever.
But it's a small community that has a lot of love at the heart of it.
[man2] There's 38,000 people in Whakatāne.
We have uh, 51 percent non-Māori, you know,
and 48 percent Māori.
[Pouroto] And our communities support one another.
And together, we have got a beautiful area,
which includes the living active, breathing volcano,
translation.ko: 지금도 활동 중인 살아 숨 쉬는 화산이 있는데

translation.en: Whakaari. The English name, "White Island."
[man] White Island is about 48 kilometers off the coast of Whakatāne.
When you're driving down the coast,
you look out across
the horizon and you see the large
plumes of white smoke coming out of the crater.
translation.ko: 커다란 흰색 연기 기둥이 보일 겁니다

translation.en: Absolutely amazing. It's just the raw beauty of nature.
translation.ko: 무척 놀라운 광경이죠 생생한 자연의 아름다움이에요

translation.en: [Pouroto] In our folklore, we come from the mountains.
translation.ko: 마오리족 설화에서는 우리가 산으로부터 태어났다고 해요

translation.en: We actually are descendants of Whakaari.
And we are the protectors of the Island itself.
She is an awesome energy and power unto her own right.
translation.ko: 화이트섬에는 그 자체로 대단한 에너지와 힘이 있죠

translation.en: But she's also very special in terms of tourism.
translation.ko: 여행하기에도 매우 특별한 곳이에요 “화이트섬으로 가는 길 화카타네 공항”

translation.en: [Hazel] People love White Island.
And so many people are connected to White Island Tours here.
translation.ko: 화이트섬 관광 안내소와 관계된 사람도 많고요

translation.en: Our restaurants,
our motels,
everything… our shops, our boutiques…
translation.ko: 상점, 기념품 가게 모든 곳이 연결되어 있어요

translation.en: All of those rely on people that adventure tourism brought to our town.
translation.ko: 모험 여행을 위해 방문하는 사람들로 마을이 돌아가죠

translation.en: [woman] Our wedding was
the most perfect magical day ever.
I don't think I ever smiled that much in my entire life.
translation.ko: 살면서 가장 많이 미소 지은 날이었던 것 같아요

translation.en: [Matt] I'm an adventure seeker.
She is absolutely not an adventure seeker.
-I'm more of a laying-out type of girl, -[Matt chuckles]
[Lauren] or um… just, relaxing at a beach, or something like that.
translation.ko: 아니면 해변에서 가만히 휴식을 취하는 걸 좋아하죠

translation.en: [Matt] So for our honeymoon, we started looking at cruises.
We found this one for New Zealand and we looked at it.
It was like, "Oh this is great! New Zealand has all this amazing geography
and attractions. This seems perfect."
[boy] My sister and I,
we really like anything that's gonna give us a lot of adrenaline,
and I suppose, put us at some kind of enjoyable risk.
Woo!
So we jumped off the Auckland Tower.
We went black water rafting.
My mom and dad had previously been on a few cruises,
translation.ko: 엄마, 아빠가 크루즈 여행을 몇 번 다녀오셨는데

translation.en: and they really enjoyed them. And they brought it to us,
my sister and I, the idea of going on a cruise to New Zealand.
translation.ko: 그래서 동생과 전 뉴질랜드 크루즈를 타기로 했죠

translation.en: And on that cruise, we were given the options of excursions onto the mainland.
translation.ko: 그 크루즈에는 본섬 관광 옵션도 있었어요

translation.en: [Lauren] I would pick out an excursion one day,
translation.ko: 저는 하루를 택해 본섬을 관광하기로 했고

translation.en: and Matt would pick out an excursion for a different day.
So December 9th was actually Matt's day to pick out an excursion.
I'm into everything science. And it sounded really interesting,
translation.ko: 저는 과학에 관심이 많아요 그래서 재미있겠다고 생각했어요

translation.en: like an actual volcano that you can walk up to and look into.
[Jesse] White Island was something different
that you wouldn't normally be able to do,
translation.ko: 평소에 쉽게 갈 수 없는 곳이니까요

translation.en: being one of the world's most active volcanoes.
[Matt] I mean, from the description, it was a nice easy hike.
translation.ko: 안내서를 읽었을 때는 가벼운 하이킹처럼 보였어요

translation.en: It's not like you need rock climbing gear and everything else to get up there.
translation.ko: 안내에 따르면 거창한 장비가 필요 없었으니까요

translation.en: It was, just walk up to the crater and look in and see this amazing volcano.
translation.ko: 그냥 걸어 올라가서 멋진 화산을 보는 거였어요

translation.en: They made it sound exciting, they didn't make it sound dangerous.
And I was like, "Okay, that… it looks good."
You know, we looked at the description, and I was like, "Okay."
translation.ko: 안내서를 다 읽고 가볼 만하다고 생각했죠

translation.en: [man] We live in Hamilton in New Zealand,
and I'm a full-time pastor at a church.
My daughter, she'd been studying through school geology and volcanic activity,
translation.ko: 제 딸이 학교에서 지질학과 화산 활동을 배웠어요

translation.en: and I said to her, "We should go while we have the opportunity to go."
translation.ko: 그래서 딸에게 기회가 되면 화산에 가보자고 말했죠

translation.en: And then for my 50th birthday,
she'd surprised me with tickets to go out to Whakaari.
translation.ko: 딸이 화카아리로 가는 티켓을 깜짝 선물로 줬어요

translation.en: [Geoff] Monday morning, it's quiet.
There's not a lot of traffic around.
We arrived at the tour office and we read through
a couple of safety documents, and then were asked to sign
translation.ko: 안전 주의사항을 읽고 연락처 정보와 가족 정보를

translation.en: just our contact details and next of kin details.
I know there's a risk and I'm there with my daughter,
translation.ko: 어느 정도 위험한 건 알았어요 전 딸과 함께 있었고

translation.en: I'm not going to put her in danger.
But at no point did I ever fear what we were actually doing.
translation.ko: 하지만 화산 체험은 전혀 두렵지 않았어요

translation.en: -[woman1] Morning! -[woman2] Morning.
[Geoff] That day, there were a few boats that toured the Island,
translation.ko: 그날 섬을 관광하는 배가 몇 척 있었는데

translation.en: and we were in the Phoenix.
We left the wharf,
traveled out on the river for five or ten minutes.
You cross the river bar heading out into the open ocean…
translation.ko: 강과 바다의 경계를 넘어 바다로 진입하게 됐죠

translation.en: And then from there on to White Island.
[Jesse] We departed from the main cruise ship around 9:00a.m.
We took an hour-long bus ride to Whakatāne,
translation.ko: 한 시간 정도 버스를 타고 화타카네로 갔어요

translation.en: to the port where we were taking off from, with 40 or so other tourists.
translation.ko: 그리고 항구에서 다른 여행객 40여 명과 함께 내렸어요

translation.en: [Matt] We all got onto the Te Puia,
and the tour guide said it was a brand new ship.
I think they just gotten it that year.
[Jesse] There were four guides on the Te Puia.
They were locals to Whakatāne,
and they were very excited to tell us about the history of White Island.
[woman] The morning of December 9th,
it was Hayden, Tipene, Jake, and myself as guides.
translation.ko: 헤이든, 티프네, 제이크 제가 가이드로 참여했어요

translation.en: We prepped the boat and then we just left like every other day.
Closer to shore, we'll take you on a fully guided tour of the inner crater area.
translation.ko: 거의 다 왔습니다 중심 분화구로 안내해드릴게요

translation.en: And this will take approximately an hour to an hour and a half.
[Mark] My younger brother, Hayden, loved the outdoors
translation.ko: 제 동생 헤이든은 야외 활동을 좋아하고

translation.en: and he had a passion for summer.
And in 2009, he started as a tour guide, guiding in Whakaari.
Hayden kept a detailed diary of every trip that he went to the Island.
translation.ko: 헤이든은 섬에 갈 때마다 세세하게 여행 일기를 썼고

translation.en: And he'd done 1,111 trips.
[Jesse] That's amazing.
[laughing] I did not know that was Hayden's 1,111th trip to the Island. No.
[Kelsey] Hayden's probably one of the longest standing guides.
translation.ko: 헤이든은 아마 가장 오래 근무한 가이드에 속할 거예요

translation.en: He helped train me at work, and then, yeah,
after work we'd go to the local fishing club,
or we'd take trips up to the Tarawera Falls.
He was always up for an adventure.
[Mark] He developed a huge passion for the whole environment.
Not just Whakaari, and not just the volcano.
translation.ko: 그 열정은 화카아리나 화산에 국한되지 않았고요

translation.en: [Jesse] The gusts were blowing, the swell was quite large.
A lot of the poor passengers actually were
being moved to the back of Te Puia
cause they were feeling quite seasick.
I was sitting with my family, we were kind of…
not making fun of them but laughing a little bit,
smirking to ourselves. We quite enjoyed being on the water.
translation.ko: 서로를 보며 웃고 있었어요 즐겁게 배를 타고 있었죠

translation.en: And we were enjoying the bumpy ride.
[Matt] We had no idea how rough the seas were going to be.
We were on that boat for probably 90 minutes.
translation.ko: 아마 90분쯤 배를 타고 간 것 같아요

translation.en: And I would say, at least seven or eight people were vomiting just 'cause
the entire ship would pitch up and then it would pitch back down,
and you would see ocean then sky, then ocean then sky, then ocean then sky.
translation.ko: 바다를 보다가 하늘을 보이고 하늘을 보다가 바다가 보였죠

translation.en: [Lauren] I was so close to throwing up.
I mean, I was literally like, holding my stomach like this.
translation.ko: 말 그대로 배를 이렇게 잡고 있었어요

translation.en: [Mark] It's an hour and a half out there and an hour and a half back.
translation.ko: 가는 데 한 시간 반 오는 데 한 시간 반이 걸려요

translation.en: Some days, you can go out there and it can be rough.
translation.ko: 바다는 매일 다릅니다 거칠 때도 있고

translation.en: It can be horrible. And if you're not used to being on a boat for an hour,
translation.ko: 무서울 수도 있죠 배를 타는 게 익숙하지 않다면

translation.en: your sea legs go pretty quickly.
Hence, there was another option as well.
You could take a helicopter and that was only a 20-minute flight.
[man] Waking up that day
for me was a little bit of nerves, a little bit of stress.
This is my first day where I was allowed to fly passengers solo.
I went to to New Zealand initially for my license.
translation.ko: 처음에 뉴질랜드에 온 건 자격증 때문이었어요

translation.en: Just looking for a good place to learn to fly.
translation.ko: 헬리콥터 조종을 배우기 좋은 곳을 찾고 있었죠

translation.en: On a clear day,
if you're taking off from the mainland, you'd be able to see White Island.
You can fly in a straight line for it.
And the conditions that day, they were just… they were perfect conditions.
translation.ko: 그날 상황은… 더할 수 없이 완벽했어요

translation.en: [Geoff] As the Phoenix got real close to the Island,
the crew are starting to prepare us for getting off.
And my daughter said, "Let's go Dad. I want to be first on the Island."
[Geoff] The tour started and uh…
we just slowly walked.
The two tour guides, one of them would go first
translation.ko: 가이드는 두 명이었는데 한 명은 앞장섰고

translation.en: and one of them would go last, and as a group we would stay between them.
translation.ko: 한 명은 뒤에서 따라오면서 관광객을 사이에 두고 걸었고요

translation.en: [Brian] It's kind of like a scene out of Jurassic Park
translation.ko: 그곳에 도착했을 때 쥐라기 공원의 한 장면이

translation.en: when you approach it.
Landing on White Island, first time for me was like landing on the moon kind of,
translation.ko: 화이트섬에 내렸을 때 마치 달에 도착한 것 같았어요

translation.en: because it's such a surreal kind of environment.
So after we landed, I gave them the safety briefing.
And I start walking towards the crater.
[Kelsey] Most of the volcano is underwater.
translation.ko: 화산의 거의 모든 부분은 물에 잠겨 있어요

translation.en: So you're only seeing the top of it.
White Island is a stratovolcano.
When it erupts, it doesn't tend to have lava flows like the Hawaiian volcanoes.
translation.ko: 폭발해도 하와이 화산처럼 용암이 흘러내리지 않아요

translation.en: It tends to put down layers of rocks
and ash, and build itself up that way.
[Matt] When the Te Puia arrived at the Island,
we had to get in these small… they call them "zodiac boats."
translation.ko: 조디악이라는 작은 배로 옮겨 타야 했어요

translation.en: They're just inflatable rubber boats.
translation.ko: 공기를 불어 넣는 고무보트 같은 배였어요

translation.en: There's just a really quick trip to the Island.
translation.ko: 그렇게 조금만 가서 섬에 내리는 거였죠

translation.en: Yeah, about a minute or two.
[Matt] Then they arrived at this very rickety cement jetty
with a rusted metal ladder on it.
[Jesse] You had the sounds of the waves crashing onto the beach,
washing up onto the shore which gave that sea breeze that smell of the salt.
And then you also have
this almost like a… a strong malodorous smell of sulfur.
translation.ko: 지독한 유황 냄새가 느껴지는 것 같았죠

translation.en: It looked quite barren. No signs of life.
translation.ko: 무척 척박한 환경이어서 생명의 흔적은 없어 보였어요

translation.en: [Matt] When we walked off that jetty and got our first real glimpse…
translation.ko: 처음 방파제에 내려서 주변을 둘러봤을 때

translation.en: I had a picture in my head of what a volcano would look like and
this was not it.
No lava. Just lots and lots of steam.
[Lauren] It was very beautiful,
but I felt like we were very much in the middle of nowhere. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 아무도 모르는 외딴곳에 떨어진 것 같은 느낌이었죠

translation.en: [Jesse] From there, we created separate groups.
My guides on the Island were Hayden and Tipene.
Tipene was, I believed to be learning. Hayden was showing him the ropes.
translation.ko: 티프네는 교육 중이었을 거예요 헤이든이 밧줄을 보여줬거든요

translation.en: Tipene was very inquisitive…
always asking questions, you know.
Proud to be a Māori.
He was excited to have that job.
He enjoyed it, going out on the boat, mixing with people.
translation.ko: 배를 타고 나가 사람들과 어울리는 걸 즐겼어요

translation.en: He loved telling them all sorts of stories,
Māori myths and legends.
He wasn't supposed to work that day.
translation.ko: 그날은 원래 티프네가 일하는 날이 아니었어요

translation.en: We were going to do some shopping.
But he was called into work to fill in for someone and then he went to work.
translation.ko: 그런데 대타로 나와 달라는 전화를 받고 출근하게 됐어요

translation.en: [Mark] These tour guides and pilots and skippers,
they know the Island so well, down to every last rock.
translation.ko: 섬을 잘 아는 사람들이었어요 작은 돌멩이까지 다 알았죠

translation.en: They know Whakaari more than anybody else.
[Hayden] Alright, everyone! Uh, welcome to White Island.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 여러분 화이트섬에 오신 걸 환영합니다

translation.en: I'll be your guide today for our little tour around the Island.
translation.ko: 오늘 저와 함께 섬을 둘러보실 거예요

translation.en: [Matt] They gave us a hard hat that had a chin strap on it,
and then they gave us a respirator.
[Hayden] So what we're gonna do is we're gonna head around the side here
up to that main crater.
Uh, stop at a few points of interest on the way.
translation.ko: 가는 길에도 관광 포인트가 몇 군데 있습니다

translation.en: I'll let you know some information about the Island.
Um, so yeah, but as long as everyone's all good,
we'll start our tour. We'll get going.
[Jesse] The first group left pretty promptly
translation.ko: 첫 번째 팀은 안전 수칙 공지를 마친 뒤

translation.en: after having a short safety brief.
We were still collecting our group together.
[Lauren] So what's this for?
So you're going to suck on them
and it's going to help produce saliva.
So that any irritation that you get from the steam itself,
translation.ko: 증기 같은 걸로 느껴지는 불쾌감을 없애주고

translation.en: it's just going to help soothe it. So you're not coughing so much.
translation.ko: 입안의 수분을 유지해서 기침을 줄여줄 거예요

translation.en: [Matt] The Island track is about a singular loop that you start at the beach.
translation.ko: 섬 관광 경로는 하나뿐이었어요 해변에서 시작하는 거였죠

translation.en: Once you reach the Crater Lake,
you turn around and make your way around the Island.
And then back to the mouth at the entrance.
[Brian] You got quite a bit of gas on the Island that tries to escape.
It's something that has to work its way up through a more viscous
translation.ko: 가는 길에는 금방이라도 튀어 오를 듯이 부글거리는

translation.en: muddy substance.
So you kind of get that bloop-bloop, those kind of noises going on.
[Hayden] So what's happening is the sulphur's coming up with the steam.
translation.ko: 이 화산에서는 유황이 증기와 함께 뿜어져 나와

translation.en: It's crystallizing, falling back down on top of itself,
and then it forms a chimney-like structure, like on a house.
translation.ko: 그렇게 집에 있는 굴뚝 같은 구조가 만들어지죠

translation.en: And so we call it the sulphur chimney area.
[Geoff] The landscape… it's rock and ash and mud.
But then strewn amongst
these grays are sulphur deposits
that are the most beautiful bright yellow,
and bright white crystals that seem to sparkle in the sunlight.
translation.ko: 밝은 흰색 결정들이 햇빛에 반짝거리는 것 같았죠

translation.en: And you actually get the feeling of the vastness
and the power of what you're encroaching on.
This glimmer of, you know, Mother Nature
at her most beautiful, but at her most deadly.
Our guide said that the lake is normally a beautiful bluey-green,
and that day it was white because perhaps overnight,
there'd been some kind of activity
that had caused ash to fall back down on the lake.
translation.ko: 화산재가 발생해서 다시 내려앉은 것 같다고 했어요

translation.en: I think it happens quite often.
And for me the guides were good with it, so I was good with it.
translation.ko: 가이드가 별일이 아니라고 하면 저도 괜찮다고 생각했어요

translation.en: [Lauren] So we start walking up towards the crater.
We stopped to take some photos every couple yards or so,
and I talked to our tour guide and I asked him,
I said, "So when was the last eruption?"
Because I'm get… my… I'm getting a little nervous here.
He said there was one in 2013, one in 2016,
and I'm like, "Well it's the end of 2019 now and I'm getting really nervous."
Hayden mentioned the Island was at a Level-Two risk.
He didn't describe what that means at the time.
translation.ko: 당시에 그게 무슨 뜻인지 정확히 알려주지는 않았어요

translation.en: Um, but he did say it's at a higher risk of activity, which to me was worrying.
translation.ko: 하지만 꽤 위험한 수준이라고 해서 좀 걱정됐어요

translation.en: [Mark] Level One, Level Two didn't really mean a lot.
Level One, you know, not much happening. Level Two was heightened activity.
And then Level Three was an eruption so, you know that…
There was a massive amount of scope between Level One and Level Three.
[Geoff] We made our way back down to where we had left off.
We got back onto the Phoenix and were just getting ready to leave.
We began to chat with one of the tour guides
translation.ko: 가이드 중 한 명과 대화를 나눴는데

translation.en: about how
all the volcanic activity at White Island had been either overnight
translation.ko: 아무도 없을 때 화이트섬 화산이 어땠을지

translation.en: or when nobody had been there.
So, it was almost like it was being kind to people to visit.
It was like "I'll erupt when you're not there" sort of thing.
translation.ko: 사람이 없을 때만 폭발한다고 말하는 것처럼요

translation.en: As we left the Island and headed back, I then look back up towards the crater.
translation.ko: 우린 배로 섬을 떠나면서 분화구를 돌아봤는데

translation.en: I can see the tour from the other boat.
[Kelsey] It was always pretty cool to get up to the crater
translation.ko: 분화구에 도착해서 사람들이 놀라는 소리를 들으면

translation.en: and just hear everyone gasp and say,
"Wow," and "Oh my God, this is amazing,"
and all start snapping photos.
We'd get geologists coming out to see it and really kind of have a look at it.
And then you get the other end of the scale, which would be like,
"I just want a photo of the crater. I just want this for Instagram."
translation.ko: SNS에 올릴 사진을 찍고 싶어 해요

translation.en: [Matt] We got to the top of the crater,
I would say probably around two o'clock in the afternoon.
You're just looking down into this gaping, never-ending pit of steam.
translation.ko: 커다란 분화구에서 끊임없이 나오는 증기를 내려다보게 되죠

translation.en: It's an intimidating sight.
They gave us another opportunity
where we could take pictures of us in front of the crater.
I noticed another ship, the Phoenix, had just departed the Island,
translation.ko: 다른 배였던 피닉스호가 섬을 떠나는 걸 봤고

translation.en: and then we hung out up there for a few minutes,
and then started the journey back down.
[Lauren] I'm thinking, "Okay, we're on our way down.
The tour is coming to an end." So I'm feeling a little bit better.
translation.ko: ‘이 관광도 이렇게 끝이네’ 기분이 조금 나아졌어요

translation.en: [Kelsey] Because they were from a cruise ship,
we were sort of on quite a tight time schedule.
So we were moving pretty quick. We're on our way back to the jetty.
[Lauren] The other tour is probably 10 minutes behind us,
and so we're leaving the crater, and Hayden is coming up towards the crater.
translation.ko: 우리가 분화구를 떠날 때 헤이든이 도착했거든요

translation.en: From the crater you kind of loop back,
then it's another 500 meters or so to the beach.
I had four passengers that day, two couples.
And at that stage, that's where we passed them with the boat,
translation.ko: 전 배를 타고 있는 관광객들과 마주쳤고

translation.en: the groups that were walking towards the crater.
I did recognize Hayden and said hi to Hayden and…
while he made his way up towards the crater with his tour group.
translation.ko: 헤이든은 자기 팀을 분화구로 안내하는 중이었죠

translation.en: [Jesse] We made our journey up to the acid lake.
We could see the bubbling in between the clouds of steam
that were wafting up into our faces.
Hayden had told us that we could only stay there for maybe two to three minutes,
just enough time to have a good look and take some photos
translation.ko: 잠깐 둘러보고 사진만 찍을 정도의 시간이었죠

translation.en: because the chemicals that were being released at the top
there were a lot more harmful.
Everyone was rushing to get a photo opportunity.
It was time to move on, single file.
My sister was right up the front with Hayden.
I was with my parents towards the middle of the group.
[Jesse] About halfway down to the jetty, there were these two water streams,
translation.ko: 방파제로 돌아가는 길에 두 갈래의 수증기가 보였는데

translation.en: and they came from different parts of the Island.
translation.ko: 섬의 다른 부분에서 나오는 거라고 했어요

translation.en: So the tour guides actually had us stop
and stick our fingers in the water and actually taste it.
You could actually taste the different mineral contents.
I had just tasted the water, and I had my back to the crater,
translation.ko: 물을 찍어 먹어보느라 분화구를 등지고 있었는데

translation.en: and I heard one of our other tourists say "Hey, look at that!"
And you turn around and see this little black cloud coming out of the volcano.
translation.ko: 그래서 몸을 돌리니 화산에서 작은 검은 구름이 보였어요

translation.en: It didn't look intimidating. I actually took a picture of it.
translation.ko: 그렇게 위험해 보이지 않아서 사진을 찍었어요

translation.en: It was just like a chimney smoke coming up. No sound.
translation.ko: 소리 없이 굴뚝에서 나오는 연기 같았죠

translation.en: [Jesse] We all turn around to see what almost looked like a black firework,
translation.ko: 모두 뒤돌아 검은 폭죽이 터지는 것 같은 모습을 봤어요

translation.en: or like a dementor from Harry Potter with a black long tail.
translation.ko: 검은 꼬리가 달린 해리포터의 디멘터처럼 보이기도 했어요

translation.en: So we all whipped out our phones, started taking photos.
translation.ko: 다들 휴대전화를 꺼내서 사진을 찍기 시작했죠

translation.en: Shortly following, there was another larger bang,
translation.ko: 곧바로 더 큰 폭발음이 한 번 더 들렸어요

translation.en: followed by a massive, even larger group of rocks, flying into the air,
and then slowly that began to increase in intensity and size.
translation.ko: 그리고 그 강도와 규모가 점점 커지기 시작했어요

translation.en: [Lauren] I knew… I knew instantly.
This is, this is bad news. This is bad news. We need to run.
[Kelsey] I turned around and saw the plume.
It was already taller than White Island.
I knew immediately what was going on.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 일어나는지 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: My brain had just… was in overdrive
and just trying to go as fast as it could to try and work out what to do.
translation.ko: 가능한 조치를 위해 최대한 빨리 움직이려고 했어요

translation.en: Now behind me,
I hear Kelsey just yell "Run!" and then it was on.
-[Lauren] Go, go, go! -[Kelsey shouts] Go, go, go!
-[man1] Annie! -[man2] Annie!
-[voices screaming, panicking] -[woman screams] Anybody?!
[Lauren] At that point, I'm frantic. I'm living my worst nightmare.
translation.ko: 그때는 제정신이 아니었어요 최악의 악몽을 꾸는 것 같았죠

translation.en: [Jesse] We hear Hayden up at the front yelling to run,
translation.ko: 위에서 헤이든이 달리라고 외치는 소리가 들렸어요

translation.en: at which point panic set in,
and we all just started running for our lives.
I had my parents right on my heels.
You could feel the shadow of the explosion rise up behind us.
[Matt] We managed to run and take shelter behind
a very large outcropping of rocks just before the ash cloud overtook us.
translation.ko: 커다랗게 튀어나온 바위 뒤에 몸을 숨길 수 있었어요

translation.en: [Jesse] It was just a black void.
All you could hear was just the sound of rumbling and just the roaring.
At that point, there was, there was nothing I could do.
translation.ko: 제가 할 수 있는 건 아무것도 없었어요

translation.en: [Geoff] We were going around to the next bay which was just around the cliff,
translation.ko: 절벽 주변에 있는 근처의 만으로 가는 중이었는데

translation.en: and that's when it erupted.
-[woman] Oh my God! -[Geoff slowly] Oh my God! Oh no.
[Geoff] I'm watching it go up and it's beautiful.
translation.ko: 연기가 뿜어져 나오는 게 정말 아름다웠어요

translation.en: The white is pure white, the black is dark.
It kind of is just… an awesome moment.
Within seconds, what was beautiful went eerily sinister.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 아름다움은 곧바로 무시무시함으로 변했죠

translation.en: This ash cloud started rolling down over the cliff.
translation.ko: 화산재 구름이 절벽을 타고 떨어져 내리기 시작했어요

translation.en: The crew are realizing what's happened.
translation.ko: 선원들도 무슨 일이 일어나는지 알아차리게 됐고요

translation.en: The boat has started to speed up significantly.
We're still outside. The crew are calling everybody into the cabin.
[man on bullhorn] Okay, everybody inside right now.
-[man1] Go inside, go inside! -[man2] Go, go go!
[man2] Jesus!
[Brian] We were walking towards the coast, and one of my passengers asked me,
"Should we run?" And I looked over my shoulder and
that's when I saw this massive eruption going on.
I remember looking up over my left shoulder
and seeing these projectiles arching towards us as well.
[Brian] To me, it looked like it was going up thousands of feet
translation.ko: 돌들이 몇 백 미터씩 위로 날아오르는 것 같았어요

translation.en: and it just wasn't ending.
I looked over at the helicopter,
which would have been about three to four hundred meters away from me.
So I… that's not an option whatsoever.
Option Two was go for some water.
So I told them to run for the water.
translation.ko: 사람들에게 물이 있는 곳으로 달리라고 했어요

translation.en: Once I got to the pier, I just went and jumped in.
I remember hitting the water and just holding my breath as long as I could.
translation.ko: 물속에서 최대한 숨을 참으며 버틴 기억이 나요

translation.en: Everything just went black.
-[water sloshing] -[man moaning]
[Brian] I just remember rocks hitting me and pelting my hardhat.
translation.ko: 돌이 날아와 제 안전모에 부딪힌 게 기억나요

translation.en: It was the darkest thing I've ever seen in my life,
translation.ko: 제 평생 본 것 중 가장 어두웠어요

translation.en: darker than any night I've ever experienced, just pitch black.
[Kelsey] If you read any literature on pyroclastic flows,
people don't walk out.
translation.ko: 나가면 안 된다는 걸 알 거예요

translation.en: I knew the odds of getting out of the back of it, so yeah…
translation.ko: 나가면 어떻게 될지 알고 있었기 때문에

translation.en: we just had to take shelter and cross our fingers, really.
translation.ko: 가만히 몸을 숨기고 기도할 수밖에 없었죠

translation.en: I held my sunglasses and my gas mask to my face and just didn't let go.
translation.ko: 선글라스와 마스크가 떨어지지 않도록 꼭 붙잡았어요

translation.en: -[Kelsey] I hear other people yelling. -[voices shouting]
[Kelsey] It's just horrific.
[Matt] I vividly remember feeling like my back was being burned off.
translation.ko: 등이 타는 듯한 느낌이 아직도 생생해요

translation.en: My arms and legs were burned so badly, so quickly, I never even felt them.
translation.ko: 팔과 다리에도 화상이 심해서 아무것도 느껴지지 않았어요

translation.en: [Lauren] I heard Matt say, "I'm sorry, Lauren."
And that broke my heart.
I hold on to his hand because I thought, "For sure,
translation.ko: 남편의 손을 잡았어요 이런 생각이 들었거든요

translation.en: we're gonna die today and I just want our bodies to be found together."
translation.ko: ‘우리는 여기서 죽을 거고 시체가 같이 발견되면 좋겠어’

translation.en: [Jesse] The smell was overwhelming.
The heat alone was just unbearable.
The superheated steam just um, burning me alive.
translation.ko: 뜨거운 증기가 저를 산채로 태우는 것 같았어요

translation.en: I did my absolute best not to breathe at all,
to keep my mouth shut, to keep my eyes closed.
I tried moving into the fetal position, just let my back take brunt of the force.
translation.ko: 태아처럼 웅크려서 등으로 충격을 견디려고 했어요

translation.en: [Brian] You know, underwater there's no noise.
And you're just waiting for kinda, you know, some light to reappear.
It feels like you just don't know when it's going to end,
because it's just no light, just nothing.
At one point, there was a bit of light. I remember looking at it.
translation.ko: 그러다가 갑자기 한 줄기 빛이 보였어요

translation.en: I thought, "Thank God for that."
I started swimming towards it but then it disappeared again.
[Lauren] I tell Matt I love him. I yell it every two seconds.
"I love you. I love you. I love you."
And all I can hear is him screaming in pain.
I've never heard him yell like that ever.
translation.ko: 맷이 그렇게 비명을 지르는 건 처음 들어봤어요

translation.en: The pain was just excruciating. The burns went through all my clothes.
translation.ko: 너무 끔찍한 고통이었어요 열기가 옷을 뚫고 들어왔죠

translation.en: [Matt] Two to three minutes was the entire eruption event.
It was the most terrifying two minutes of my life by far.
I thought "This is it.
This is my last day on this planet. We're going to die on our honeymoon."
translation.ko: ‘이게 내 생의 마지막이야 신혼 여행에서 죽는구나’

translation.en: [Geoff] I remember looking out of that window,
and I now can't see the Island at all. It's gone.
[Brian] Time for me felt like it was going slower.
translation.ko: 시간이 아주 천천히 흐르는 것 같았어요

translation.en: And I always said, "Look, if anything ever would happen to me,
translation.ko: 전 항상 말하곤 해요 ‘만약 나한테 사고가 생기면’

translation.en: I feel like I have lived, you know, for my age, a very good full life,
and I'm satisfied to where I got."
But at that time I realized, "Nope, I'm not ready to let this go just yet.
translation.ko: 하지만 그때 깨달았죠 ‘난 아직 준비가 안 됐어’

translation.en: I think I'm just gonna keep on eh…
trying my best to get out of this situation alive."
The ash started to settle on the surface of the water,
light started to reappear, and that's when I came back up.
translation.ko: 빛이 다시 보이기 시작해서 물 위로 올라갔죠

translation.en: I looked behind me towards the Island.
You could see that all the… it was still a fine amount of ash still in the air
translation.ko: 여전히 공기 중에는 엄청난 양의 재가 떠 있었고

translation.en: kind of falling down onto the island.
[Matt] First thing I did was yell out Lauren's name.
translation.ko: 가장 먼저 한 일은 로렌의 이름을 외친 거예요

translation.en: I was in such bad shape, I was afraid she had died.
translation.ko: 제 상태도 안 좋았지만 로렌이 죽었을까 봐 두려웠죠

translation.en: It's okay.
[whispers] It's okay.
So eventually…
[Matt] when I saw her moving, I think she said, "I'm here, I'm here."
translation.ko: 아내가 움직이는 걸 봤을 때 목소리가 들리는 것 같았어요

translation.en: That was the biggest relief I've ever felt in my life when she responded.
translation.ko: 살아오면서 최고로 안심했던 순간인 것 같아요

translation.en: That was my worst nightmare would be if I survived and she didn't.
translation.ko: 혼자 살아남았다면 최악의 상황이 됐을 거예요

translation.en: That would be worse than anything else.
I wouldn't have been able to live with myself.
[Jesse] Once the eruption ceased,
I suppose I was out of shock, I just stood up and I walked a few meters over.
translation.ko: 충격을 받은 상태로 일어나서 조금씩 걸었어요

translation.en: We were a small distance away from the acid lake.
Uh, there was screaming and shouting, um, crying.
I could see some people rolling around on the ground, um… struggling,
in severe pain, which was a horrible sight to see.
[Kelsey] Just gradually… it just got less, and then it just stopped and
it was still and it was quiet. And so I thought,
"Well it's now or never."
So got up and started yelling at everyone to follow me
and get up and then started heading back to the jetty.
[Brian] For me, personally, physically, I was perfectly fine.
But everybody who was on the Island during the eruption, none of them were okay.
translation.ko: 하지만 폭발 도중 섬에 있었던 사람들은 괜찮을 리 없었죠

translation.en: Nobody managed to escape that steam.
translation.ko: 그 열기에서 아무도 빠져나오지 못했을 테니까요

translation.en: That steam, you're talking about 200º Celsius.
So that's… you come out looking like a boiled chicken, pretty much,
translation.ko: 대충 말하자면 삶은 닭이 되는 거나

translation.en: to put in a rough way.
I just looked down at my arm and
there's just like an entire layer of skin just flopping off.
I mean, I knew I was in bad shape and I knew she was in bad shape.
translation.ko: 저나 아내 모두 상태가 좋지 않았죠

translation.en: The only thing on my mind was, "We are getting off this Island now."
[woman yelling] Please run. Run! Please run.
[Lauren] I was really struggling to walk.
I fell a couple of times.
Matt was burnt a lot worse than I was
because he was wearing a lot less clothes than I was, but he was helping me.
translation.ko: 저보다 옷을 얇게 입었거든요 그래도 남편은 절 도왔어요

translation.en: [Matt] I was running pure adrenaline.
I knew roughly where the jetty was and that was where I was going.
translation.ko: 방파제 위치를 대충 기억해내고 그쪽으로 향했어요

translation.en: [Brian] At that point, I could see one of the groups walking towards the pier
translation.ko: 그때 한 팀이 항구로 걸어가는 게 보였어요

translation.en: and they all started collecting at the pier.
Twenty people or so waiting to be helped.
I didn't know we were going to do this,
but the skipper took the boat back
to where we'd just come from.
And as we headed back there,
we went into the shadow of the ash cloud so it went dark.
-[woman] Oh Jesus Christ. -[voices mutter indistinctly]
[man on walkie-talkie] Hey Whakatāne Coast Guard, Phoenix, do you copy?
[man] I heard the call come through the VHF, of the skipper that I knew,
translation.ko: 알고 지내던 선장의 목소리가 무전기에서 들려왔습니다

translation.en: sounding very distressed,
"There's people on the Island and she's erupting."
And you could hear the distress in his voice that this was serious.
-[seagulls squawking] -[telephones ringing]
Instantly, my phones just started ringing.
I then ran across the car park out to the river where you could see White Island.
translation.ko: 달려 나가 주차장을 가로질러 화이트섬을 보러 갔어요

translation.en: Sure, enough. It was a big cloud above the Island
and it wasn't stopping.
[woman] Jesus.
[Isaac] It was only about five minutes later
he's asking again where the help was,
translation.ko: 구조대 위치를 다시 묻는 선장의 목소리에서

translation.en: so that emphasized the distress that they must have been under.
They're calling for help
translation.ko: 바로 몇 분 뒤에 재촉할 정도로

translation.en: and just a couple minutes later, they're asking, "Where is that help?"
[man] Someone came into our office just after 2:00p.m.,
translation.ko: 2시가 막 지났을 때 누군가 경찰서에 들어와서

translation.en: and told us that Whakaari was erupting.
We don't have a direct line of sight to Whakaari, but over the hills,
translation.ko: 여기서는 언덕 때문에 화카아리가 보이지 않습니다

translation.en: we could see a fairly impressive cloud.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 위로 커다란 구름이 보였죠

translation.en: Another staff member said, "Oh, well. There's the cameras.
translation.ko: 경관 한 명이 기억해냈어요 ‘설치된 카메라가 있어요’

translation.en: Let's go check the cameras."
And we saw what, you know, were basically small black dots,
but we knew that those were people and that's when
for us then it registered that there were people on there.
translation.ko: 섬에 사람들이 살아 있다고 바로 보고했습니다

translation.en: We were working.
We had a deadline.
We started hearing the sirens and we're like, "What's going on?"
[Hazel] I drove down to the Mataatua reserve,
pulled up, ran up, ran across that big grassy patch.
We knew something was wrong.
The plume was bigger than usual.
People were just staring at Whakaari erupting, basically.
translation.ko: 사람들은 폭발을 보고 있을 수밖에 없었어요

translation.en: [Maangi] I was at home and I saw the breaking news.
People were starting to arrive at my house and…
translation.ko: 사람들이 우리 집에 하나둘씩 오기 시작했는데

translation.en: geez, I was still
trying to think myself and get it, you know?
Just wondering…
[Pouroto] I was actually at a Māori funeral,
and I could feel through the energy
of my speaking there that something wasn't right.
[Pouroto] When I went to look, I could see the smoke coming up,
and it wasn't a normal volcanic cloud above Whakaari,
it was very dark and dense.
When I realized it was real, I actually just broke down and cried.
[Andy] There was a bit of confusion initially in terms of who the tourists
translation.ko: 처음에는 조금 혼란스러웠어요 섬에 간 여행객들이 누군지

translation.en: were that went on the Island,
and actually who had taken them there.
But we were certain
that there were people left on the Island at the time of the eruption.
translation.ko: 폭발 당시 섬에 사람이 있었다는 사실이었죠

translation.en: [Isaac] We put the call out for help to the Whakatāne Coast Guard,
translation.ko: 화카타네 해안 경비대에 전화해서 지원을 요청했고

translation.en: and they steamed out towards White Island.
But that's an hour and a half trip by sea.
translation.ko: 한 시간 반을 가야 하는 거리였죠

translation.en: It was frustrating because we had to, um,
you know, our boats to get that far,
it's always going to be a little bit of wait.
And then from Auckland, rescue helicopters also headed out to White Island.
[Andy] There were air ambulance helicopters,
Westpac Rescue helicopters.
They're search-and-rescue experts
with all the equipment and resources necessary,
but they were also probably an hour out from the Island.
translation.ko: 화이트섬에 도착하려면 한 시간이 걸리는 상황이었어요

translation.en: -[woman] Oh my God there are people there. -[man] Look at the boat.
translation.ko: - 세상에, 사람들이 있어 - 저 배 좀 봐

translation.en: [Geoff] When we first got back to the Bay,
we can see everything is just covered in this gray ash.
translation.ko: 회색 화산재가 모든 걸 뒤덮고 있었어요

translation.en: Your brain just can't process what you're seeing.
translation.ko: 뭘 보고 있는지 파악할 수 없었죠

translation.en: One thing that caught my attention was this helicopter.
[woman] Oh shit. Look at that helicopter. Look.
[Geoff] And I can very clearly see that it is now been pushed backwards.
translation.ko: 헬리콥터가 뒤로 밀린 게 똑똑히 보였어요

translation.en: It's now half off the deck and the rotors are bent.
translation.ko: 반쯤 기울어 있었고 프로펠러가 굽어 있었죠

translation.en: That was the first time that I, uh, really started to think about
the forces of what had actually happened during that eruption.
[Geoff] I remembered that I took three or four photographs
a few minutes after we'd left the jetty.
translation.ko: 사진을 몇 장 찍었던 기억이 나요

translation.en: If you look real closely,
you can see just these little dots of people right up on the crater.
[Jesse] My group was still near to the crater.
translation.ko: 우리 팀은 여전히 분화구 근처에 있었어요

translation.en: We were all approximately 100 to 150 meters
away from the point of the eruption.
To my left, I could see my parents.
um, my father was sitting up, struggling with his gas mask.
translation.ko: 아버지는 앉아서 마스크 때문에 애먹고 있었죠

translation.en: I couldn't see my sister at the time.
I could see my mother
just lying there. Not really, not really moving.
Or communicating, in any way.
[woman tearfully] There were so many people…
[Geoff] The Island is continuing to blow out steam from the Crater Lake.
And we can see people at the jetty.
[man] I see at least 16.
[woman] Oh God, they're just covered in ash.
[woman tearfully] Oh my God. Oh dear babe.
[Geoff] As soon as we'd seen how bad the eruption was,
it kind of changed our purpose.
This is now about needing to help people.
[Brian] At that point, I had to make a decision,
"Do I swim for the boat and make sure I'm safe,
translation.ko: 배로 헤엄쳐서 내 안전을 확보할 것인가

translation.en: or do I go back and try and help?
This is a time where you're tested and do the best you can.
translation.ko: 시험에 드는 때고 최선을 다해야 하는 때죠

translation.en: I swam back over to the pier and started helping people into rubber boats.
translation.ko: 전 항구로 돌아가 사람들을 고무보트에 태우기 시작했어요

translation.en: [Matt] Everybody is in a frantic race to get onto that Zodiac boat.
We didn't know if that was a pre-eruption before the main event.
translation.ko: 더 큰 폭발이 일어날지도 모르는 상황이었어요

translation.en: So it was just pandemonium on that jetty. We needed to get off this Island.
[emotional woman] I might jump.
-[man] Just wait! -[woman2] Wait! Wait!
[voices] Wait!
[Matt] We tried to get onto the first boat
which actually stopped at the jetty, but people pushed ahead of us,
translation.ko: 방파제에 정박한 배였는데 이미 사람들이 타고 있어서

translation.en: we couldn't get on it. So then, on the next one, I grabbed the ladder, get on,
translation.ko: 탈 수가 없었어요 다음 배로 가서 사다리를 타고

translation.en: then I kind of just flopped into the boat.
[Lauren] Okay.
-[woman2] Don't touch me, oh. -[woman1 whimpering]
-[woman] Don't touch me. -[voices crying] Oh God.
[Brian] At that stage it was quite a bit of chaos,
you know, so people are trying to jump in,
and you kind of had to hold them back. Pushed them back a bit.
I remember grabbing their hands, helping them into the boat,
translation.ko: 배에 타는 걸 도우려고 손을 잡았는데

translation.en: and their skin would just come off in your hands, you know.
So this is really like uh… a kind of war movie situation, you know?
[woman2] Oh my God.
[woman gasping] Come and…
-[man shouts] Help! -[woman shouts] Help!
[Geoff] The inflatable came back to the Phoenix,
and one of the guides got out three or four first aid kits,
translation.ko: 가이드 중 한 명이 구급상자를 몇 개 꺼냈어요

translation.en: and I can see that she's distressed
and I was quite close to her and I said to her,
"Both my daughter and I were first-aid trained.
Can we help?" Her response was, "We need all the help we can get."
So I picked up that first aid kit,
-walked to the back of the boat. -[chilling music plays]
-Those first survivors… -[indistinct background chatter]
…were coming onto the boat.
And we set up a a triage,
uh, we're sitting them down. We're just trying to alleviate
the pain of a burn with cool water.
They were just screaming, "Get me out of here. Get me away from here."
[Geoff yelling] The boats are here, the boats are here now!
-[woman] Oh my God. -[Geoff yelling] The motor's going.
[Brian] They were burned from 45% to 80% or even like full, fully burnt.
So survival rates after 45%, they go down significantly as well.
So you know you're dealing with people who…
who are going to die within the next hour or so making their way back to shore.
translation.ko: 돌아가는 길에 죽을 수도 있었던 거예요

translation.en: It was a, quite a dire situation.
And at that stage, the boat was at full capacity.
translation.ko: 그 시점에 보트에는 사람을 더 태울 수 없었죠

translation.en: You know, so we had to get back to shore as fast as we could.
[Mark] I got a call from my wife,
and she said, "There's a massive amount of smoke coming off Whakaari.
Is your brother all right?"
And I said, "Well, I think so." I said, "I haven't heard anything.
translation.ko: ‘그런 것 같은데 아무 소리도 안 났어’

translation.en: But I believe, hey,
Hayden would let us know."
And I looked through the gap out to the ocean there.
And man, she was… there was… a big plume of smoke had come up.
translation.ko: 엄청나게 큰 연기 기둥이 솟아오르고 있었어요

translation.en: [Mark Law] I was driving along the coast,
and that's when I noticed a really, really big plume,
bigger than normal and definitely darker than normal.
I was looking at it, looking at going, "That's… something happening."
translation.ko: 연기를 보며 생각했어요 ‘무슨 일이 생겼나 봐’

translation.en: [man] Volcanic Air had a message that there'd been an eruption.
translation.ko: 볼케닉 에어가 폭발이 있었다는 메시지를 받았죠

translation.en: I had actually been able to view on one of the volcano cameras,
translation.ko: 화카타네 해안에 설치된 화산 카메라 중 하나를

translation.en: located at the coast at Whakatāne.
I think it became pretty apparent that,
you know, sitting back and doing nothing wasn't an option.
We knew that there were people on the Island.
translation.ko: 섬에 사람들이 있는 걸 알고 있었어요

translation.en: We had the means and the ability to try and help
translation.ko: 그 사람들을 도울 수단이 우리에게 있으니

translation.en: and it's just the right thing to do, and that's what we did.
translation.ko: 해야 할 일이 있었고 그 일을 한 거예요

translation.en: [Mark Law] Like all things, you know,
when it comes down to making decisions and things happening,
you either do or you don't. So I do.
I called Tim and I said, "I'm going."
And he said, "Yeah, I'll see you up there."
I called two really experienced people that worked for me.
translation.ko: 함께 일하는 두 명의 뛰어난 경력자도 불렀어요

translation.en: I said "Go and get a machine out ready to go, fuel it up.
Grab some gear that you think we might need,
grab some extra masks and some water."
And then they took off. A few moments later, I lifted.
translation.ko: 직원들이 이륙했고 몇 분 뒤, 저도 뒤따랐죠

translation.en: [Mark Law] You could hear all the chit-chat going on on the radio
and that's when I heard John Funnell's voice.
[man] I was actually
doing some flying at Whakatāne in my airplane,
just testing out some new equipment.
That's when I heard Mark Law on the radio, calling for a fixed-wing.
translation.ko: 그때 고정익 항공기를 요청하는 마크 로의 무전이 들렸어요

translation.en: [Mark Law] We needed someone circling overhead who was like a relay station
or a means of passing communication,
because there is very limited cell phone coverage on White Island.
There's no fixed radio or any radio system there.
[John] I volunteered my help.
I had plenty of fuel, I had the ability to get out there.
translation.ko: 연료도 가득 차 있었고 갈 수 있었으니까요

translation.en: And uh, never gave it a thought about not going.
[Brian] All the victims were kind of laid around the boat,
uh, at the front, at the back.
We all kind of fell into our own roles, assisting people.
translation.ko: 우리는 모두 사람들을 돕기 위한 역할에 몰두했어요

translation.en: I think every one of us on that boat did help quite a bit.
translation.ko: 배에 있는 사람들 모두 조금은 도움이 됐을 거예요

translation.en: [Geoff] So we're dealing with exposed hands,
legs, faces, but the burns were far worse than that.
I remember that being a key moment where I thought
"What would burn you through an item of clothing,
but didn't burn the clothing?"
I realized actually that the steam caused injuries far worse, that we couldn't see.
translation.ko: 그리고 증기가 훨씬 더 심각한 부상을 입히는 걸 깨달았죠

translation.en: [Matt] There wasn't room for us in the cabin.
We actually ended up riding on the bow of the ship,
getting splashed by salt water in the cold air and the sun.
translation.ko: 차가운 공기와 햇빛을 뚫고 바닷물을 맞으며 항해했어요

translation.en: It was a horrific ride back.
[Kelsey] I just keep looking up at the horizon thinking,
"How are we not there yet? Surely it's been hours." [chuckles]
translation.ko: ‘아직 멀었나? 한 시간은 된 것 같은데’

translation.en: But yeah, I mean you could hear the boat at just total capacity,
translation.ko: 어쨌든 배는 최고의 속력으로 달리고 있었어요

translation.en: and so yeah it was like, "Keep going boat. Keep going Phoenix."
[Isaac] The Phoenix had about 26 injured
or critically injured people on board.
That's when I thought,
"Shit, there's a whole boatload of people that are still to be accounted for."
translation.ko: ‘젠장, 섬에는 아직 사람이 이만큼 남아 있어’

translation.en: [Jesse] I've neared the acid lake.
I was just sitting there rocking… rocking in pain.
Everything, my whole body was just tingling. I had, I could see my arms,
uh, covered in gray ash.
And I was thinking, "I'm gonna die here. I'm gonna die. That's going to be it."
I was sat in the middle of about half a dozen or more people.
People who were dead or dying.
In that time, you could hear the voices slowly start to dissipate.
The screaming becoming less frequent.
The crying becoming more quiet.
I knew you've got your highest likelihood of surviving
any kind of trauma if you've received medical assistance within the first hour.
translation.ko: 최초 1시간 내로 의료 지원을 받아야 해요

translation.en: After sitting there for half an hour,
I came to the realization that no one was coming.
translation.ko: 아무도 오지 않을 거란 걸 깨달았어요

translation.en: And then something just clicked.
Just get up and go and go find some help.
Standing up and walking away from my parents,
translation.ko: 일어나서 부모님을 뒤로 하고 걷기 시작했어요

translation.en: that was… I would say, the toughest thing I've ever had to do.
But once I did find that strength, it was less so a walk,
but more of a stumble. A forceful pushing myself just to keep on walking.
[Brian] Fifteen to twenty minutes into the trip back,
that's where people started kind of screaming out,
just saying "I need water! I need water!"
[Geoff] We just did what we could with Matt and Lauren.
And these guys at the front.
What was in my first aid kit
was of far less value than the container.
I tipped everything out of my first aid kit and started to fill it with water.
We just start to pour cold water just over their hands,
over what we can see that is exposed.
[Brian] Everybody was screaming for relief in a certain way.
I think we were all just doing what we could at that time.
translation.ko: 당시 할 수 있는 건 다 했던 것 같아요

translation.en: I was told a few times,
you know, "You need to sit down.
You probably inhaled a lot of ash and stuff."
But um… it's very hard to sit down in a situation like that,
translation.ko: 하지만 그런 상황에서 앉아만 있을 순 없었죠

translation.en: you know. So you just keep going.
[Lauren] They wrapped me in a blanket to keep me warm,
translation.ko: 사람들이 체온 유지를 위해 담요를 덮어줬어요

translation.en: and then Geoff Hopkins even, you know, kept his body to keep me warm.
[Geoff] She tells me, "I'm… I'm not going to make it.
I'm not going to make it."
"Yes, you are. This isn't the end of your life.
translation.ko: ‘아뇨, 살 거예요 오늘은 죽는 날이 아니에요’

translation.en: You have got many years ahead of you."
She asked if I would just hold her hand,
and I couldn't, hold it, because it was just so badly burnt.
translation.ko: 화상이 너무 심해서 그럴 수 없었어요

translation.en: [Lauren] I'm not normally a religious person, but I remember praying to God,
translation.ko: 종교를 믿는 사람은 아니지만 신께 기도했어요

translation.en: that He would just end my life,
just so I wasn't in pain anymore. And that's where I lost consciousness.
translation.ko: 고통에서 벗어나게 해달라고 그러다가 정신을 잃었어요

translation.en: [Jesse] It was very difficult for me to breathe.
My legs felt heavy.
There was a lot of effort every single step uh, to keep going forward.
translation.ko: 한 걸음씩 나갈 때마다 엄청난 노력이 필요했어요

translation.en: I recall Hayden previously telling us in the safety brief to try
translation.ko: 헤이든이 안전 수칙 공지에서 알려줬던 물줄기를 따라가면

translation.en: to follow the stream back to the beach.
I rounded a bend where I had to cross the stream.
It was very hot, it was burning, and I had to jump across it.
And all I wanted to do was just to sit down again.
But I knew if I take a break and sit down, I'm not going to get back up again.
translation.ko: 하지만 그러면 다시는 일어나지 못한다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: [Mark Law] As I got to the Island, you could see
it was still ashing quite significantly.
translation.ko: 엄청난 재가 여전히 떠 있는 게 보였습니다

translation.en: Quite a column of ash and steam.
So I thought, "Well okay. I'll have a look around."
So I flew into the crater.
I remember looking down and going, "Gosh, that looks like a person.
That looks like more.
No, it looks like a guy sitting."
And then I thought, "Hang on, there's a lot more."
[John] I was trying to fly with both radios and the cell phone.
I was keeping upwind of the ash cloud, and to one side,
just going backwards and forwards.
I knew that we had to get information out to the authorities
translation.ko: 당국에 최대한 많은 정보를 전달해야 했어요

translation.en: as to how bad the situation was so they could plan
translation.ko: 상황의 심각성을 알려야 계획을 세울 수 있고

translation.en: and put more resources in if needed.
[John] I said to Mark, "We need to know the number of dead
and the number of injured."
[Mark Law] I tried to land in a couple places too dusty,
and so I found one of my wood helipads,
translation.ko: 그러다가 나무로 된 헬리패드를 하나 찾았어요

translation.en: and zeroed in onto that,
and just flew straight into it, into sort of like a brown-out.
[Mark Law] I left the aircraft running. Grabbed my mask and jumped out.
translation.ko: 시동을 끄지 않고 마스크를 들고 내렸어요

translation.en: I then picked up some footprints down the creek.
translation.ko: 그리고 개울을 따라 나 있는 발자국 몇 개를 발견했죠

translation.en: [Tim] And I was focused on planning my approach into the Island,
you know, it was really dusty.
So, we had to be pretty committed to our landing.
I initially forgot my mask and I didn't get very far from the helicopter
translation.ko: 마스크를 챙기는 걸 잊었는데 헬기에서 몇 걸음 떼자마자

translation.en: before I realized it was hard breathing out there.
It was really hard. You had to have a mask on.
[Tim] Saw one person, then I saw another.
translation.ko: 한 사람이 보이고 또 한 사람이 보였어요

translation.en: Saw a bunch just sort of further up.
translation.ko: 그리고 점점 더 많은 사람이 보였습니다

translation.en: Conscious, just, but barely conscious.
Some people crying out louder than others.
translation.ko: 어떤 사람들의 목소리는 더 크게 들렸어요

translation.en: [John] I could form a picture of what was happening down there.
translation.ko: 아래가 어떤 상황인지 대충 예상할 수 있었습니다

translation.en: We just kept finding more and more people all the time that needed help,
translation.ko: 계속해서 도움이 필요한 사람들을 더 많이 찾아냈어요

translation.en: and it was just… it became very obvious very quickly to me,
it was a major calamity we had on our hands.
[Mark Law] I called the guys in.
I gave them a brief. I said, "Look, there's a lot of people here.
Quite a few of them are dead.
There's a lot alive and we're going to go to all of them."
[John] We were passing the information to air traffic control.
So that they would direct the two Westpac Rescue helicopters into White Island.
translation.ko: 화이트섬으로 두 대의 구조 헬기를 띄울 수 있었어요

translation.en: I said, "We've got people in extreme pain here
and we've got no medical equipment.
We've got no helicopters with stretchers.
We need you guys here on the Island."
They responded straight away.
"We'll come direct."
So I called Mark up and said "Help's on its way.
It… it will get better soon."
[Mark Law] So at that time, we just started working through
all the folks on the ground,
really just clearing their airways,
clearing their noses, putting some people in recovery positions,
putting gas masks back on people,
and dabbing water where we could.
translation.ko: 호흡기가 달린 마스크를 씌워주고 물을 조금씩 뿌려줬습니다

translation.en: And just continuing until we got further assistance.
translation.ko: 지원이 올 때까지 그 작업은 계속되었어요

translation.en: The ash was still falling on us.
And then every now and again we'd hear
big, you know, booms as stuff was going on in the plume.
Anyway, cracked on.
[Isaac] The Whakatāne Coast Guard boat met the Phoenix just about halfway
translation.ko: 피닉스호가 화카타네로 돌아가는 길 중간 지점에서

translation.en: back to Whakatāne, pulled up alongside.
The skipper advised that they had multiple critical people on board.
translation.ko: 선장이 배에 부상이 심각한 사람이 많다고 했죠

translation.en: So it was elected to put the ambulance crew
on board the Phoenix to assist with their care for their return trip.
translation.ko: 돌아가는 동안 응급 처치를 받을 수 있도록 했습니다

translation.en: Paramedics jump on and then suddenly we were away again.
My expectation was, "Ah, the paramedics will take over."
translation.ko: 그래서 이제 구급대원이 대신 처치해줄 거라고 예상했죠

translation.en: But the reality was even though they had a big kit,
translation.ko: 하지만 구급대원이 들고 온 큰 상자에는

translation.en: there wasn't anything in that kit that was going to help.
And really the paramedic just said, "Just keep doing what you're doing.
Just keep reassuring. There's nothing else we can do."
translation.ko: ‘계속 안심시켜 주세요 지금 할 수 있는 게 없어요’

translation.en: [Hazel] People had started gathering down on the waterfront there,
along the river mouth.
I could see lots of ambulances, police.
Um… it felt like every person
who was a frontline emergency staff member was there.
[Isaac] Once we knew boats were on the way back,
that's when I'd go and clear the wharf for them
because I knew they'd be heading through the first wharf and unloading.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 부두에서 내릴 게 확실했거든요

translation.en: [man] We were just around trying to establish
where we would set up the triaging for the people coming off the boats.
translation.ko: 배에서 내릴 부상자를 분류할 준비를 했습니다

translation.en: [Mark] I had a little bit of denial, a little bit of disbelief.
translation.ko: 이런 사고가 일어난 걸 믿고 싶지 않았어요

translation.en: I thought, "You know what, I probably should just give Hayden a quick call."
And I tried ringing him and I got no reply.
I guess being a small community,
your network of connections spreads a little bit wider.
And so my wife rang our family friend.
And asked if everything was all right,
and she said, "It's not good."
I picked the kids up and raced into town.
translation.ko: 전 아이들을 태우고 마을을 향해 달렸어요

translation.en: [Maangi] We drove down to Whakatāne,
straight to White Island Tours.
We just saw the ambulances and um… police everywhere.
They had the whole family around, um… we were all, you know, just waiting for news.
translation.ko: 가족이 모두 모여 소식을 기다리고 있었죠

translation.en: [Jesse] I made it to a rocky outcrop,
and you could see the view of the water, and I was like,
"I made it," and then directly in front of me
was one of the crew members from the Phoenix.
translation.ko: 피닉스호에 있던 가이드 한 명이 있었는데

translation.en: -He had the radio to his mouth… -[indistinct radio chatter]
…saying something like "That's it, it's… might be time to wrap up."
As soon as I heard that I just yelled with whatever energy that I had left.
translation.ko: 그걸 듣자마자 온 힘을 다해 소리쳤어요

translation.en: It was more like a scream.
And then he turned around with a wide-eyed expression,
translation.ko: 눈이 휘둥그레진 그 사람이 뒤를 돌아봤어요

translation.en: like the shock on his face saying like, "Holy, holy crap."
And he straight away just said, "I have a survivor.
Um… let's go."
And then when I flung my arms around his shoulders,
translation.ko: 그 사람 어깨에 제 팔을 둘렀을 때

translation.en: I just remember saying "Uh, my family."
All I wanted to do the whole time was just get him to allow me to take him back
translation.ko: 제가 원했던 건 그 사람이 저와 함께 가족이 있는 곳으로

translation.en: to where everyone else was.
He was like, "It'll be okay. We're going to get you back to the ship now."
So we boarded the Te Puia and then departed.
[John] I'd lost track of all time because I was just so busy
translation.ko: 계속 경로를 잃었어요 항공 교통 관제탑과

translation.en: trying to communicate with air traffic control.
"We urgently need help out here. We just keep finding more survivors
translation.ko: ‘긴급 지원이 필요합니다 계속 생존자를 찾고 있어요’

translation.en: and needing more help."
They called back, probably five minutes later,
and said "We've been directed by the Communication Center
that we're not to go to the Island."
[Andy] The decision was made at a higher level,
that there'd been a no-fly zone put in place.
And this was due to the dangerous environment there around the Island.
translation.ko: 섬 주변의 환경이 너무 위험했기 때문이죠

translation.en: Quite toxic, quite acidic, and quite dangerous for any rescuers.
translation.ko: 독성, 산성도가 너무 높아 구조대원도 위험했습니다

translation.en: And there was a high risk of another explosion.
translation.ko: 또 다른 폭발이 일어날 위험도 있었고요

translation.en: [man] At this stage, it is too dangerous
for police and rescue services to go to the Island.
The Island is currently covered in ash and volcanic material.
translation.ko: 현재 화이트섬은 화산재와 화산 물질로 뒤덮여 있습니다

translation.en: We are taking expert advice with regards to safety of any rescue attempt.
translation.ko: 안전한 구조를 위해 전문가의 자문을 받고 있습니다

translation.en: [John] I called Mark's team back on the ground again, and said,
"You just have to do what you can with what you've got.
translation.ko: ‘지금 모든 수단을 동원해 사람들을 구해야 해요’

translation.en: You're on your own."
[Mark Law] He goes, "No, they're not coming."
So I said, "Oh yeah? Uh, okay."
translation.ko: 그래서 저는 알겠다고 대답할 수밖에 없었죠

translation.en: Then we essentially just moved into Plan B,
and that was, "We're going to do it ourselves."
[John] Mark and his team were facing a horrendous situation
with multiple patients with severe scalding burns.
translation.ko: 게다가 심각한 화상을 입은 환자까지 여러 명 있었죠

translation.en: This is the stuff that nightmares are made out of.
[Mark Law] At that stage, we got everyone together
and it became a combined effort to identify the survivors,
and start to get them onboard the aircraft.
It was just, "Let's get everyone who's still living off this island."
translation.ko: 아직 살아있는 사람은 다 태우려고 했습니다

translation.en: Once we started to move people, we realized how severe the injuries were.
translation.ko: 사람들을 이동하게 하면서 부상의 심각함을 알게 됐습니다

translation.en: Whole legs were just, you know, just blistered and trying to pick people up,
translation.ko: 다리는 온통 물집이었고 사람들을 부축했을 뿐인데

translation.en: and skin was coming off in our hands,
and all over our clothing and things like that.
translation.ko: 손과 옷에 온통 피부 조각이 들러붙었죠

translation.en: But you can't, you can't sit there and dwell about it.
translation.ko: 하지만 다른 생각은 할 겨를이 없었습니다

translation.en: You eventually just got to get on and talk to people,
tell them what you're going to do.
"Okay, right, you're going in the helicopter.
We're gonna lift you up here.
You'll be 20 minutes away to a hospital."
You know, when people are down and out and nearly gone,
words are tremendously powerful.
And we didn't have time to pull up our seats.
We had to, you know, lift people up right up high.
We used some seat belts, just to hold people up more than hold them in.
translation.ko: 사람들이 잘 앉아 있도록 안전벨트를 채웠어요

translation.en: We finally got five people into the first helicopter, and then he left.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 헬기에 5명을 태우고 드디어 이륙할 수 있었습니다

translation.en: So, we loaded my one up and then I lifted off.
[Tim] I had one on board the aircraft,
and then we got one more on board.
We couldn't get any more in the back of my aircraft.
translation.ko: 더 태울 수 있는 공간이 없었어요

translation.en: So then I got airborne with those two.
I just remember thinking that I wish this helicopter would fly faster,
and really my only thoughts flying back were
with the people in the back of my aircraft.
You know, we gave them water to try and uh, assist.
And to, you know… but yeah.
[John] That was a horrendous, huge effort on their part.
There was little more they could have done.
translation.ko: 그 사람들이 할 수 있는 건 별로 없었어요

translation.en: There were no more survivors left.
The only people left on the island were the deceased.
[Geoff] As we approach land, Mike the skipper said,
translation.ko: “폭발 2시간 후” 섬에 가까워지면서 마이크와 선장이 말했어요

translation.en: "Hold on because we're just going to go through this at full speed."
[Jason] That boat did not stop when it went over that bar.
It just carried at that speed up the river,
which we had never seen before.
I remember thinking that, "You know, this boat is coming at speed for a reason."
translation.ko: 무슨 이유가 있어서 서두르는 걸 거라고 생각했어요

translation.en: [Geoff] There was a line of paramedics, a line of police,
a line of fire fighters,
and they were just looking wide-eyed
trying to take in what they could see.
I guess almost with shock.
[Jason] That's when we got our first visual on the casualties.
translation.ko: 그때 사람들의 부상을 처음 직접 보게 됐거든요

translation.en: I mean, I'd never seen… a human body
um, in an eruption, so I wasn't, you know, exactly sure…
what it would look like.
a police officer I'd seen coming in, with his hands full of Glad Wrap.
translation.ko: 비닐 랩을 잔뜩 들고 오던 게 기억나요

translation.en: They're trying to get all the stuff that they could
translation.ko: 화상 상처를 덮을 수 있는 모든 도구를

translation.en: from the local stores to cover the burn wounds.
[Matt] I heard Geoff yell to the paramedics,
"Get her off first. She's in critical condition."
[Geoff] Matt walked off the boat which just amazed me.
translation.ko: 맷이 배에서 내려오는 걸 보고 정말 놀랐어요

translation.en: I was very clear that I did not want to be separated from her,
translation.ko: 저는 한시도 아내와 떨어지고 싶지 않았고

translation.en: so they actually let me ride in the ambulance with her to the hospital.
translation.ko: 그래서 함께 구급차를 타고 병원에 가도록 해줬죠

translation.en: [Jason] Where I was, the three people I had, um…
translation.ko: 제가 있던 곳에 세 명이 있었는데…

translation.en: There was this moment when, um, one of them, um, just slumped,
slumped on me.
And um…
and I just think at that point in time,
I just had my own little moment.
-[seagulls squawk] -[eerie music continues]
Um, I remember standing up, taking a breath,
turning around, and facing the other side of the river,
and then turning back
and just having total clarity of what we needed to do.
[Kelsey] There was fire and ambulance, and police.
And somehow in that whole crowd,
I managed to spot my mom and sister,
and I remember thinking, "They can't see me like this."
translation.ko: 제 모습을 보여줄 수 없다는 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: So I got up and I couldn't actually straighten out my limbs.
translation.ko: 그래서 일어나려고 했는데 팔다리를 뻗을 수 없었어요

translation.en: And so I kind of had to walk a bit odd to the side of the boat…
Beelined it straight for the ambulance,
'cause I didn't want them to see me in that much pain.
translation.ko: 가족에게 고통스러운 모습을 보여주고 싶지 않았거든요

translation.en: [news reporter] The first casualties from a volcanic eruption
translation.ko: 화이트섬에서 이송된 초기 화산 폭발 사상자는

translation.en: being stretchered from White Island clearly suffering burns.
translation.ko: 심각한 화상으로 고통을 겪을 것으로 보입니다

translation.en: Of course, there's still a number unaccounted for.
translation.ko: 물론 아직 정확한 숫자는 파악되지 않았습니다

translation.en: Twenty of them we believe are seriously injured.
[Mark] I race into town.
My mom and dad were there.
One of the skippers said, [in choked voice] "Hayden didn't come off.
translation.ko: 선장 한 명이 말했어요 ‘헤이든은 못 나왔어요’

translation.en: He isn't… hasn't come off."
But he wasn't 100 percent sure where he was.
translation.ko: 하지만 선장도 헤이든의 위치는 모르고 있었어요

translation.en: And we said… [stuttering] "But no, it's… it can't be. How?"
He said he didn't know whether he's on a helicopter or not. He wasn't sure.
translation.ko: 헬리콥터에 탔는지 안 탔는지 아무것도 모른다고 했어요

translation.en: [Mark Law] We had it tapped out, you know, it was going as fast as we could,
probably 120 knots.
There were some instructions coming from the Rescue Services,
that we were to fly to the airport with all the patients,
but I said "No, we're not doing that.
We're going to go to hospital."
It's just straight out of time, wasted time.
I felt that Rescue Services, you know, they'd already let us down.
So you know, the hospital wasn't going to let us down because we'd just arrive.
translation.ko: 병원은 도착하면 환자에게 필요한 조치를 해주겠죠

translation.en: They were going to go into that hospital
and you had lots of people that could take care of them quickly.
translation.ko: 거기 있는 사람들이 빠르게 치료해줄 테니까요

translation.en: [Matt] I had the thought, "My mom's going to wonder what happened
translation.ko: 우리가 엄마에게 아무 연락도 하지 않으면

translation.en: to us when we just stop communicating with her at all."
And I still had my cell phone with me. So, I asked one of the people nearby
translation.ko: 휴대전화를 갖고 있었지만 옆 사람에게 전화를 걸어달라고

translation.en: to call my mom. I couldn't work it because it was a fingerprint unlock
translation.ko: 부탁했어요, 휴대전화 잠금을 제 지문으로 풀 수 없었거든요

translation.en: and I didn't have any fingerprints left.
[Matt] Hi Mom, it's me. I just wanted to let you know,
translation.ko: 엄마, 나예요 우선 지금 말씀드릴 건

translation.en: and this isn't a joke,
the volcano actually erupted while we were on the Island,
translation.ko: 우리가 섬에 있을 때 화산이 폭발했어요

translation.en: so we're at a hospital in New Zealand.
translation.ko: 그래서 지금 뉴질랜드의 병원에 와 있어요

translation.en: I don't know how long I'll be here,
but I'll try and keep you updated as best I can.
[Matt] At that point, we got separated.
I didn't really understand how bad of shape I was in.
translation.ko: 제 상태가 얼마나 나쁜지 전혀 몰랐어요

translation.en: I certainly didn't expect I was going to be in a coma in…
in New Zealand for over a month or more.
translation.ko: 혼수상태로 있을 줄은 전혀 예상하지 못했어요

translation.en: They cut off my wedding ring and I remember begging them
not to do that because I had just gotten married.
I was just heartbroken and… and I wouldn't look when they cut it off.
translation.ko: 너무 가슴이 아팠고 자르는 걸 제대로 볼 수 없었어요

translation.en: [Geoff] You go from a situation where
there's urgency to suddenly when the urgency stops.
translation.ko: 응급 상황에서 벗어나 갑자기 모든 게 정리됩니다

translation.en: And it's not until that moment then,
when suddenly what we were doing now had been passed
to a professional,
did we start to process what had just happened.
I called my wife.
As soon as she answered, I couldn't talk.
translation.ko: 아내가 받았지만 아무 말도 할 수 없었죠

translation.en: You know the tears just started [stuttering] to come out of nowhere.
[Brian] Everybody was very,
you know, emotionally and physically wrecked at that stage.
Jolene, my girlfriend, came over to pick me up, and I was able to,
you know, hug her and…
that's, I think, when emotionally everything hit me for the first time.
translation.ko: 그때 처음으로 감정이 휘몰아쳤던 것 같아요

translation.en: [Maangi] We heard from the police there were eight still on the Island
translation.ko: 화카아리 섬에 8명이 남아 있고 다 사망했다고

translation.en: on Whakaari, passed away.
Tipene was one of them.
I dropped on the floor.
I couldn't believe, I couldn't believe that I was hearing, you know…
translation.ko: 제가 들은 걸 믿을 수 없었어요

translation.en: Parekura we call it. Tragedy.
[Mark] Once we got the word that the last helicopter landed,
translation.ko: 마지막 헬리콥터가 착륙했다는 얘기를 들었을 때

translation.en: you know, I actually rang Mark Law for an update of what was happening.
translation.ko: 마크 로에게 전화해 상황이 어떤지 물었어요

translation.en: [Mark Law stuttering] I just… I just, you know, I felt as friends,
you know, like uh… we just have to let them know,
you know, as soon as possible.
You know, "I was there with Hayden and he definitely passed away."
translation.ko: 제가 헤이든이 죽은 걸 분명히 봤다고요

translation.en: He had seen Hayden, and um…
He'd seen him on the Island, and said that he hadn't made it.
[Mark] Mark talked about seeing footsteps in the ash.
And they believe that it was Hayden and Tipene that had moved about
and helped the final few, I guess,
be comfortable in their last moments.
translation.ko: 사람들이 마지막 순간에 편히 눈감게 해주려고요

translation.en: I know both Tipene and Hayden put everybody first, before themselves.
translation.ko: 제가 아는 티프네와 헤이든은 늘 다른 사람을 먼저 생각해요

translation.en: But he wasn't coming home.
[woman] It is now clear that there were two groups on the Island,
translation.ko: 지금 분명히 밝혀진 사실은 섬에 두 팀이 있었는데

translation.en: those who were able to be evacuated
and those who were close to the eruption.
translation.ko: 한 팀은 폭발 지점 가까이에 있었다는 점입니다

translation.en: To those who have lost or are missing family and friends,
we share in your unfathomable grief at this moment in time and in your sorrow.
translation.ko: 위로의 말씀을 전해드리며 삼가 조의를 표합니다

translation.en: Your loved one stood alongside Kiwis
translation.ko: 당신이 사랑하는 이의 곁에는 뉴질랜드가 있으며

translation.en: who were hosting you here and we grieve with you and we grieve with them.
[reporter1] The official death toll from that volcanic eruption
translation.ko: 뉴질랜드 화산 폭발로 인한 공식 사망자 수는

translation.en: in New Zealand now stands at eight.
[reporter2] Nine of them have now been confirmed dead…
-the latest, teenage brothers… -[reporter3 speaks in Mandarin]
[reporter4] Death toll from Monday's disaster has now risen to at least 15.
translation.ko: 월요일의 재앙으로 인한 사망자 수가 15명에 이릅니다

translation.en: [reporter7] He was a dedicated public servant…
[reporter9] Among the 21 victims were her husband, Gavin,
and 15-year old daughter, Zoe.
[Kelsey] I didn't really know what had happened for three weeks.
No one had told me still,
but a friend of mine came to visit me on the Burns Unit,
translation.ko: 친구 중 하나가 화상 병동으로 찾아왔어요

translation.en: and I'm like "Oh, how's Hayden? Like I'm surprised I haven't seen Hayden."
translation.ko: ‘헤이든은 어때? 나 아직 헤이든을 못 봤어’

translation.en: And she just like looked at my family and yeah, they all burst into tears.
translation.ko: 친구가 제 가족을 보더니 모두 눈물을 흘리기 시작했어요

translation.en: And yeah, that's how I found out.
[Jesse] I woke up on the 17th of December.
My grandfather was the one that… broke the terrible news to me.
My father was rushed by Mark Law straight to the hospital,
where unfortunately he, uh, succumbed to his injuries.
Uh, my mother did pass away on the Island,
and she was uh…
recovered by the New Zealand Army a few days later.
translation.ko: 며칠 후에 뉴질랜드 군대가 시신을 수습했다고 했어요

translation.en: And they're not sure where my sister was or what had happened to her body.
translation.ko: 그리고 여동생은 어떻게 됐는지 알 수 없다고 했어요

translation.en: [Pouroto] When the ancestor, Tītahi, did die,
it is said in our folklore, that his spirit,
it had transformed as one of the guardians of the ocean today.
The dead themselves, they too have become similar to the ancestor Tītahi.
Whakaari has given her sanction, her consent,
to have them there as guardians, kaitiaki, forevermore.
They take their place in time where they will never be forgotten.
translation.ko: 그들은 그곳에 자리 잡고 영원히 잊히지 않을 겁니다

translation.en: [Lauren] Some days are good, some days aren't,
translation.ko: 어떤 날은 괜찮고 어떤 날은 아니에요

translation.en: if you want me to be 100% honest with you.
I know people are looking at me; I know people are looking at my hands.
translation.ko: 사람들이 저를 보고 제 손을 보는 게

translation.en: Um… I don't like it.
I always feel like I have to explain ahead of time
what these are from. [laughs drily]
I have days where it's easier than others.
[Matt] All right. So brussels sprouts on one side,
apples and sweet potatoes on the other.
translation.ko: 다른 한쪽에는 사과와 고구마를 놓는 거야

translation.en: [Lauren] My husband and I are training to run in a half marathon,
translation.ko: 남편과 저는 하프 마라톤을 준비 중이에요

translation.en: so some days when I'm focused on things like running,
it's good, and yes, I can see my future.
I can see happy days, and I can look past the volcano.
translation.ko: 행복한 미래도 보이고 화산 폭발도 돌아볼 수 있어요

translation.en: But, um… [sighs] Yeah, some days are really hard.
Yeah.
[Matt] My ring finger doesn't really work all that well,
and that really messes with me on my dominant hand.
At this point, we're still getting a surgery a month.
translation.ko: 지금도 한 달에 한 번 수술을 받고 있어요

translation.en: The timeline with this recovery is just so, so, so long.
The eruptions was two minutes, but the consequences are multiple years.
translation.ko: 폭발은 단 2분이었는데 후유증은 몇 년을 가요

translation.en: I understand nobody controls nature,
translation.ko: 사람이 자연을 통제할 수 없다는 건 알아요

translation.en: but you have to at least give me a chance to make an informed decision.
translation.ko: 하지만 최소한 결정하도록 알려줄 기회는 있었잖아요

translation.en: Had I known what I know now,
there's zero percent chance we would have ever set foot on the island. Zero.
translation.ko: 절대 그 섬에 가지 않았을 거예요, 절대로

translation.en: [Kelsey] Yes, so I was burnt from my boot line
to my shorts line and the back of my legs,
back to my knees was actually spared because being crouched down,
it actually protected the backs of my knees which was good.
translation.ko: 그렇게 해서 무릎 뒤쪽이 보호했니 그나마 다행이죠

translation.en: I knew what could happen out there.
translation.ko: 폭발이 일어날 가능성이 있다는 건 알았지만

translation.en: But you don't believe it will happen to you.
translation.ko: 그게 자기에게 일어날 거라고 생각하는 사람은 없어요

translation.en: This hasn't changed my opinion on how I will interact with nature.
translation.ko: 하지만 자연과 소통하는 제 방식은 변하지 않았어요

translation.en: I mean, I won't live in a padded room
because what kind of life is that?
I guess I know that I can get through anything now,
translation.ko: 지금은 무엇이든 헤쳐 나갈 수 있을 것 같아요

translation.en: so I mean that's worth something.
Maybe not to anyone else but to me, it's worth something. [laughs]
translation.ko: 다른 사람은 모르겠지만 저는 그 가치를 깨달았어요

translation.en: [Jesse] Throughout my whole stay in hospital,
I made it a really strict point to take progress photos every other day,
translation.ko: 이틀마다 회복 상태를 확인할 사진을 찍었어요

translation.en: so I can look back at them and see how far I've come.
translation.ko: 다시 봤을 때 제가 어떤 일을 겪었는지 볼 수 있으니까요

translation.en: I've had 17 surgeries.
I was told that I would be spending a year in hospital.
But I'm pretty proud to say that my total stay was
translation.ko: 하지만 두 달 만에 병원에서 나왔고

translation.en: just under two months.
I'm a stubborn bastard.
I refuse to give up. I'll just keep on trying and trying.
Uh, and I refuse to quit, no matter how hard it gets.
I still love a risk.
But calculated risk I think is the word that needs to be said.
translation.ko: 하지만 어느 정도의 위험인지 알려줘야 한다고 생각해요

translation.en: They shouldn't have been there.
Should never go there.
I can see Whakaari from my home.
I see it from every room in my home. Yeah.
translation.ko: 집에 있는 모든 방에서 화카아리가 보여요

translation.en: The less I see of it the better, to tell you the truth.
So you just shut the curtain, let it be.
Say a little prayer.
Then you do the same thing the next day. And the next day and…
translation.ko: 내일도, 그 내일도 똑같이 살아갈 수 있도록…

translation.en: yeah.
[Mark] I think, you know, in some ways
we understood the Island,
that it's an unknown outcome.
translation.ko: 예상치 못한 사고가 발생할 수 있죠

translation.en: Mother Nature does what she wants to do.
But there's also human nature.
And in the face of adversity,
it's human nature to go and help.
Ordinary people willing to give their own lives to help others.
translation.ko: 사람이라면 기꺼이 목숨을 바쳐 다른 사람을 도울 거예요

translation.en: That's what makes people… the good people in the world who they are.
translation.ko: 그런 본성이 사람들을 좋은 사람으로 만드는 거죠

translation.en: [Kelsey] A lot of positive has come from such a horrific event.
translation.ko: 끔찍한 사건으로 많은 부분이 긍정적으로 변화했어요

translation.en: The Community Support has been quite overwhelming.
I have friendships that I wouldn't trade for the world.
You have to take something positive
because otherwise that cloud will just follow you forever.
translation.ko: 그렇지 않으면 평생 저를 따라다닐 테니까요

translation.en: [Jesse] My gym, and my work colleagues,
my friends, my family,
are who all push me to keep on going.
translation.ko: 모두 제가 앞으로 나가도록 힘이 되어줘요

translation.en: They've given me the drive to keep working hard.
Especially my grandfather, my rock.
He's been with me from the very beginning.
And I would never have been able to make it this far without his love and support.
translation.ko: 할아버지의 사랑과 응원이 없었다면 불가능했을 거예요

translation.en: [Matt I have a perfect unburnt spot on my wrist.
translation.ko: 손목에 전혀 화상을 입지 않은 부분이 있어요

translation.en: That is the exact outline of where her hand was.
translation.ko: 로렌의 손이 있던 모양이 그대로 남아 있죠

translation.en: [Lauren] It was like this.
Yep, that's why this hand is much better than this hand.
translation.ko: 그래서 이쪽 손이 이 손보다 훨씬 나은 거예요

translation.en: Like I can't even make a fist in this hand, and this hand,
I can make a fist fully.
I will always be by his side. Always.
I just love him so much and this has made us even closer, I feel like.
translation.ko: 폭발 사고가 우리를 단단하게 만들어준 것 같아요

translation.en: [Mark] I try to get out there every couple of months and go and say, "Hi."
translation.ko: 몇 달에 한 번씩 섬에 인사하러 가요

translation.en: And Hayden's favorite drink was a Steinlager beer,
you know, a good Kiwi beer.
And we take a dozen out with us and we sit out there and whoever's with us,
translation.ko: 맥주 한 팩을 들고 섬에 가서 누구와 있든

translation.en: we have a couple of drinks and we always pour one in the ocean, you know?
translation.ko: 함께 마시다가 한 캔은 바다에 부어요

translation.en: As much as I hate wasting one, [chuckling] we always pour one in
translation.ko: 맥주를 버리는 걸 싫어하는 제가 항상 하나를 붓죠

translation.en: and give him a drink. [chuckles]
So you do, you look for little moments and you look for signs,
translation.ko: 그렇게 하고 잠시 기다리면서 메시지를 찾는 거예요

translation.en: I guess to find your ways of moving forward.
translation.ko: 계속 살아갈 응원의 메시지를 찾는 것 같아요

translation.en: In the face of Mother Nature, and all that she can throw at us,
translation.ko: 대자연이 우리에게 보여줄 수 있는 위력 앞에서

translation.en: we've still got to remember that as humans, we'll always have each other.
translation.ko: 우리는 사람으로서 서로가 있다는 걸 기억해야 해요

translation.en: Subtitle translation by: Ayolope Koiki
